This page highlights software packages I’ve developed to support open and reproducible research, particularly in eye-tracking and gaze data analysis.

---

## gazeR

<img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18429968/46034046-472caa80-c0c5-11e8-89c3-ff3f463a1868.jpeg" alt="gazeR logo" style="float: right; height: 120px; margin-left: 20px;">

`gazeR` is an R package for processing and analyzing eye-tracking data.  Contains pupil and gaze  preprocessing functions.

- 🐙 **GitHub**: [gazeR](https://github.com/dmirman/gazer)  
- 📄 **Documentation**: [Read the Paper](https://link.springer.com/article/10.3758/s13428-020-01374-8)

---

## webgazeR

<img src="https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/18429968/413459761-ef82786d-a1a6-4246-a5b2-00eb1312edef.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..VLyAusgN7vIexHpG4A32HCZX5Jw2SqRs1Zs_eEeRCh8" alt="webgazeR logo" style="float: right; height: 120px; margin-left: 20px;">

`webgazeR` is a browser-based eye-tracking toolkit for processing webcam gaze data collected online.

- 🐙 **GitHub**: [jgeller112/webgazeR](https://github.com/jgeller112/webgazeR)
- 💻 **Website**: [Package site](https://jgeller112.github.io/webgazeR/)
- 📄 **Documentation**: [Read the preprint](https://osf.io/preprints/psyarxiv/7jqea_v5)
